member.name: M:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalContext.GetInterfaceDateTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts a date/time in universal time (UTC) to the corresponding date and time on the current interface; uses the TimeOffset to adjust for time skew between PC and server.
member.param: Date/time to convert, in UTC
member.returns: The converted date/time on the current interface, adjusted for time offset between PC and server.

member.name: M:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalContext.GetInterfaceDateTime(System.Int32,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Overloaded version of GetInterfaceDateTime that allows the caller to specify an interface, instead of using the current one.
member.param: Numeric ID of an interface on the current site.
Date/time to convert, in UTC
member.returns: The converted date/time on the specified interface, adjusted for time offset between PC and server, or null if the interface ID was not valid.

member.name: M:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalContext.GetTimeZoneDateTime(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts a date/time in universal time (UTC) to the corresponding date and time in the specified time zone.
member.param: Name of target time zone
Date/time to convert, in UTC
member.returns: The converted date/time on the specified interface, adjusted for time offset between PC and server, or null if the interface ID was not valid.
member.remarks:
The time zone name must be specified appropriately, using the standard UNIX time zone naming conventions. The name is of the form "XXXxYYY", where XXX is the abbreviation for the standard time zone, x is the offset of that timezone from GMT in hours, and YYY is the abbreviation for the daylight savings time zone. For example, EST5EDT is the Eastern U.S. time zone and MST7MDT is the Mountain U.S. time zone.
The system does recognize the names "EASTERN" (synonymous with EST5EDT), "CENTRAL" (CST6CDT), "MOUNTAIN" (MST7MDT), and "PACIFIC" (PST8PDT).

member.summary: Indicates whether the current profile has the specified bit set in the specified group.
member.param: Bit number to check - value in range [0..31]
Group of bits to check - current values in range [1..7], defined as follows: 1 - global, 2 - CSS, 3 - MA, 4 - SA, 5 - Contact, 6 - Org, 7 - Survey
member.remarks: This allows users to check new permissions for the profile before a Boolean property like those above has been added.
member.returns: True if the Group

member.summary: Method that allows the add-in to fetch the record of the specified type associated with the current workspace in the UI.

member.returns: Record of the requested type, or null if a record of that type is not associated with the current workspace.

member.summary: Method that allows the add-in to fetch the record of the specified type associated with the current workspace in the UI. Use this version of the method to work with Custom Objects.
member.param: String identifying the type of Custom Object requested. Should be formatted PackageName$ClassName
member.returns: Record of the requested type, or null if a record of that type is not associated with the current workspace.

member.name: M:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IRecordContext.GetScriptQuestions
member.summary: Retrieve a list of the questions that are on any scripts currently associated with the workspace, along with the response to each question.
member.returns: List of questions and their responses, or null if no questions available

member.name: M:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IRecordContext.RefreshWorkspace
member.summary: Method to force the refresh of primary data associated with the workspace record type. This method will not refresh relationship data of the workspace record type
member.remarks: If the add-in updates primary fields in a workspace record directly, the changes will propagate into the workspace immediately. Primary fields are defined as the data dictionary fields associated to the workspace record type. For example, first name or last name for a contact record workspace record type. However, changes made to relationship data, such as a task to a contact or incident will not be reflected when invoking this method. To see changes to relationship data it is recommended the add-in force a save on the workspace by using the ExecuteEditorCommand from the IAutomationContext.

member.name: M:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IRecordContext.IsEditorCommandAvailable(RightNow.AddIns.Common.EditorCommand)
member.summary: Checks to see whether the specified command is available for the editor associated with the record context.
member.param: Editor command to check
member.returns: true if command is available for editor, false otherwise

member.name: M:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IRecordContext.ExecuteEditorCommand(RightNow.AddIns.Common.EditorCommand)
member.summary: Executes the specified command of the editor associated with the record context, if possible.
member.param: Editor command to execute
member.returns: true if able to execute command, false otherwise

member.name: M:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IRecordContext.TriggerNamedEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Cause the specified named event (from the client workflow) to be executed.
member.param: Name of event to execute
member.returns: true if able to execute event, false otherwise

member.name: T:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IAppMenuButton
member.summary: Interface that must be implemented by any add-in that should be used as a button in the UI's application menu.
member.remarks: This interface has been replaced by the newer IAppMenuButton2 interface, and this one will be deprecated - all new add-ins should use the newer interface.

member.name: M:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IAppMenuButton.Click
member.summary: Method on the add-in which will be called when the user clicks the button in the app menu.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IAppMenuButton.Text
member.summary: The text that will label the button in the app menu.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IAppMenuButton.Image
member.summary: The image that will be used as the button in the app menu. This should be a 32x32 pixel image.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IAppMenuButton.KeyTips
member.summary: The keytip that will be associated with this button in the app menu.
member.remarks:
(Also known as access keys or accelerators). A string of one to three upper case characters that is a keyboard shortcut for the button. The string must not contain whitespace (spaces, tabs, newlines).
When the ALT key is pressed, the keytips for UI controls can be used to invoke their functions (similar to the shortcut). The keytip for an app menu button causes the right-hand menu for that button to be displayed. It will not notify the button that it was clicked.
The keytips are context-sensitive; you can have the same keytip on items in different right-hand menus, and the one that is invoked is the one that is being displayed in the right-hand menu.
If more than one item on the same right-hand menu uses the same keytip, the first item on the menu will be activated.

member.name: T:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonTab
member.summary: Interface that must be implemented by any add-in that will be used to add a global (always present) tab to the ribbon.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonTab.Text
member.summary: Name to be used for the tab

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonTab.KeyTips
member.summary: The keytip that will be associated with this tab in the ribbon.
member.remarks:
(Also known as access keys or accelerators). A string of one to three upper case characters that is a keyboard shortcut for the item. The string must not contain whitespace (spaces, tabs, newlines).
When the ALT key is pressed, the keytips for UI controls can be used to invoke their functions (similar to the shortcut). The keytip for a ribbon tab causes the tab to be displayed on the ribbon.
If more than one item uses the same keytip, the first item on the ribbon will be activated.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonTab.Order
member.summary: Value used to sort ribbon tabs.
member.remarks: The add-in ribbon tabs always come after the pre-defined tabs, but they will be sorted using this value if there is more than one.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonTab.Visible
member.summary: Indicates whether tab should be visible on ribbon.

member.name: E:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonTab.VisibleChanged
member.summary: Occurs when [visible changed].

member.name: T:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonGroup
member.summary: Interface that must be implemented by any add-in that will be used to add a group to a global (always present) tab on the ribbon.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonGroup.Text
member.summary: Name to be used for the group on the ribbon tab.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonGroup.TabName
member.summary: Name of the add-in ribbon tab on which to place group.
member.remarks: This should be the fully-qualified name of the class that implements the tab. For instance, if you create a class MyDomain.MyRibbonTab that implements IGlobalRibbonTab and want this group to appear on that ribbon tab, HeaderName should return "MyDomain.MyRibbonTab".

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonGroup.Order
member.summary: Value used to sort ribbon groups.
member.remarks: The groups on an add-in ribbon tab will be sorted by ascending value of this field. Groups with the same order value will be sorted alphabetically by Text.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonGroup.Visible
member.summary: Indicates whether group should be visible on tab.

member.name: E:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonGroup.VisibleChanged
member.summary: Event notified if visibility is changed for the group.

member.summary: Method called when user clicks button on Ribbon (also called if button function is invoked by shortcut or keytip).

member.summary: Name to be used for the button on the ribbon tab.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonButton.Tooltip
member.summary: The tooltip text that will be displayed for the button.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonButton.Image16
member.summary: The image that will be displayed as an icon for the button, if the small version of the button is used. This should be a 16x16 pixel image.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonButton.Image32
member.summary: The image that will be displayed as an icon for the button, if the large version of the button is used. This should be a 32x32 pixel image.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonButton.Shortcut
member.summary: Keyboard shortcut to invoke the button function (alternative to clicking it with the mouse).

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonButton.KeyTips
member.summary: The keytip that will be associated with this button in the ribbon.
member.remarks:
(Also known as access keys or accelerators). A string of one to three upper case characters that is a keyboard shortcut for the item. The string must not contain whitespace (spaces, tabs, newlines).
When the ALT key is pressed, the keytips for UI controls can be used to invoke their functions (similar to the shortcut). The keytip for a ribbon button causes the button to act as if it had been clicked.
If more than one item uses the same keytip, the first item on the ribbon will be activated.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonButton.GroupName
member.summary: Name of the add-in ribbon group in which to place button.
member.remarks: This should be the fully-qualified name of the class that implements the group. For instance, if you create a class MyDomain.MyRibbonGroup that implements IGlobalRibbonGroup and want this menu item to appear in that group in the ribbon, GroupName should return "MyDomain.MyRibbonGroup".

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonButton.Order
member.summary: Value used to sort ribbon buttons.
member.remarks: The buttons in an add-in ribbon group will be sorted by ascending value of this field. Buttons with the same order value will be sorted alphabetically by Text.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonButton.Visible
member.summary: Indicates whether button should be visible on tab.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonButton.Enabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the button is active and can be clicked.

member.summary: Event notified if visibility is changed for the button.

member.name: E:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.IGlobalRibbonButton.EnabledChanged
member.summary: Event notified if enabled is changed for the button.

member.name: P:RightNow.AddIns.AddInViews.ITask.TaskTemplateID
member.summary: The ID number of the task template associated with the task. A task that has this ID set is considered to be a strategy task, and they can only be associated to one stage of a strategy. The IOptlItem list used for this field requires special handling, it contains a hierarchy with 3 different values for the Type property. A Type of 88 denotes the IOptlItem is a strategy and is a top-level item. A Type of 89 denotes the IOptlItem is a stage and is a child to a strategy item. A Type of 90 denotes the IOptlItem is a task template and is a child to a stage item. This field is visible on create and update operations. This field is not visible on delete operations. This field is returned with get operations.
